patterns: Why is my account in the format of [firstintial+lastname+number] rather than [firstname.lastname] or [firstinitial+lastname+number+.student]?
Why is my username [firstinitial+lastname+number] instead of [firstname.lastname] or [firstinitial+lastname+number+.student]?
Why is the format for my account [firstinitial+lastname+number] instead of [firstname.lastname] or [firstinitial+lastname+number+student]?
Why does my account use [firstinitial+lastname+number] rather than [firstname.lastname] or [firstinitial+lastname+number+student]?
responses:
We've adopted a new standard naming convention. Accounts that were created before the new naming convention will remain intact and will function as they should. All new accounts (faculty, administrators, staff, students, etc.) going forward will follow the new standard naming convention: [firstintial+lastname+number].

If you would like to set up an alias for your account, please send an email to its@manhattan.edu and we will forward your request to the appropriate group for processing. 

Hint: This can only be done for employees.

patterns: I'm having trouble logging into my account
I can't log into my account
I'm having trouble accessing my account
I'm having difficulty accessing my account
Logging into my account is giving me problems
responses:
If you are experiencing strange behavior when attempting to log in to the portal, please try closing the browser down completely and then logging in to a JasperNet service by typing in your JasperNet ID in all lowercase. For example, if you logged in as "Training.User1" you might have trouble logging into the Portal, but if you log in as "training.user1" (in all lowercase) you shouldn't have any issues.

If you have any further trouble, please contact us at ITS@manhattan.edu or (718) 862-7973.

intents.tag: How to Update Your Personal Email
patterns: My personal email address, which the school has on file, needs to be changed.
My personal email address, which the school has on file, needs to be changed.
I wish to update the personal email address that the school has on file for me
I'd like to change my personal email address on file with the school
I'd like to update the school's record of my personal email address.
responses:
Please visit the Self Service Email Page to access the page that allows you to update your personal email address.
 If an email shows up under "Personal Email Address", click on that email. Follow the same rule for the "Parent" email addresses. 
If "Personal Email Address" does not come up, select "Personal Email Address" from the drop down next to "Type of E-mail to Insert".
 Then click the "Submit" button. Please follow the same instructions if "Parent" email does not come up. 
Note that you must only enter one email in each email field.

Type your email in the field that states "URL".
Note that you must only enter one email in each email field.

patterns: How long do I get to keep access to my account?
How long do I have access to my account?
How long will I have access to my account?
How long can I keep my account?
How long am I allowed to keep my account?
How long do I have access to my account?
responses: As a student, your account will be kept for one year from the last time you were registered for classes.

patterns: If I work here and I am also a student, do I need two accounts?
Do I get two accounts if im a student-worker?
Do I need two accounts if I work here and am a student?
Do student workers need two accounts?
responses: People at Manhattan College only have one account associated with them. If you are a student and you begin to work here or vice versa, then your account will be updated accordingly.

patterns: Is the Duo app free to use?
Is the Duo app available for free?
responses: Yes! There is no cost associated with downloading Duo.

patterns: Can I opt out of Duo?
Is it possible to opt out of Duo?
Is it possible for me to opt out of Duo?
responses: No. Once you are enrolled in Duo there is no way to opt out.

patterns: How hard is it set set up MFA?
How hard is it to setup MFA
responses: No.  The majority of employees that have enabled MFA have provided feedback indicating that it was much easier than expected.

patterns: Why should you enable Push notifications?
Why should Push notifications be enabled?
responses: Enabling push notifications is easier, quicker, and more secure than receiving a text message or phone call.

patterns: Why do I have to use Duo for MFA?
Why am I required to use Duo for MFA?
Why must I use Duo for MFA?
responses:
Using MFA ensures that sensitive information is protected when you access services such as Banner.
 It does this by requiring a secondary means of allowing access to your account such as a cell phone, tablet, security key.
 Using Duo negates the need for VPN and will allow usage of Banner and other services that require you to be hard wired to the College's network.
